sourceDesc.p: ST JOHN'S COLLEGE LIBRARY COLLECTION OWNED LETTERS FROM ROBERT (1895-1985) AND BERYL (1915- ) GRAVES TO WILLIAM GRAVES (1940- )

body.p: Season of colds and coughs; I've had mine, Mother is still wrestling with hers, Tom√°s can't make up his mind. The barometer dropped to nearly zero and o the storm and rain!

Meanwhile we had the four little Weedons in the house until Tom died last Monday, painlessly after a long coma. Everyone behaved beautifully: Rovira persuaded the priest to allow him burial in a Catholic cemetery & the whole village went up to view the difunto & bring flowers & escort him with candles to the cemetery a 1/2 of an hour away, where the Lord's prayer was said, & all walked away silently.

The only awful character was Polimani who refused to enter the house, and only sent a bill for 16 pesetas for 2 kilos of oranges; afterwards complained that the heater borrowed by Veronica for Tom was broken and must be repaired at her expense - but it was only his plug that was wrong!
Somebody offered to sell his grandmother's grave and dispose of her elsewhere, but V. didn't like the headstone, so is making other arrangements.
The child who felt the death worst was Fiona the youngest. Now they have all gone back but V. is worn to a rag by a fortnight of almost no sleep. We are buying them a poodle puppy to restore morale.
"Apparently" had two ps; I do wish you had learned to read English before Spanish - our fault!
body.note: Ava sent me a pink tie from Rome hoping it found me in the pink!

postscript.p: I'll try to get the Valldemosa's address on my way to Palma tomorrow, if we survive until then, and enclose it. These dates are more or less: come to London about the 8th or 9th & R. goes to N.Y. 15th & T & I stay on until he returns Feb 1st about.
P.S. Enclosed is the address - they left here on Sunday.
